Posts.Content: Val_A wrote: Brief synposis of things... registered with a doctor ( we are from the UK and after 4 years of living here I finally got round to it) as part of my full physical I had a routine mammogram screening, told the results would be in about 7 days....2 days later my results were through and I needed to go for a diagnostic mammogram and an ultra sound..arrangend and had that a few days later and was told it would be a week for the results...not half an hour in the car going home I get an email to say my results were ready...as soon as we got home I logged into my doctors record to find I had mircocalcifications and needed to have a Stereotactic biopsy.  Next day I had a call from my clinics BC center and arrange to go in for that on March 13th..I had one biopsy on my (outside right) and 2 on my (inside) left...today I had a call from my boobie doctor who told me the right was clear ..whoop whoop!! but they found pre-cancerous cells on the left.  I have an appointment to see the Breast Surgeon on Friday ( March 22nd) morning to go over the results and arrange for a lumpectomy, she said that I will not need radiation....which is great.. My sister is a BC survior of 15 years but today I got a call from my neice to say my sister has found another lump and is waiting for tests to be done. I havent told any of my family about the last few weeks...including my daughter, we are waiting until we see the surgeon on Friday and will tell at the weekend when we skype...but now I dont know if to mention it to my neices' and sister....so I am sitting here with what is a diagnosis but no knowledge of the actual results and feeling in kind of limbo..... I was looking for information on other stuff when I stumbled on this site  and read some of the inspiral stories.  I wasnt sure if to post or what to say but figured I have nothing to loose and at least a place to let off steam Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Concerned, not too worried, but in a bit of a daze Val_A Moderators
